keyword: calories in subway tuna salad sandwich
title: Calories in Subway Tuna Salad Sandwich
meta_description: Discover calories in subway tuna salad sandwich: about 480 kcal for a 6-inch version, plus full macros, sodium details, and customization tips.
h1: Calories in Subway Tuna Salad Sandwich
assumptions: 6-inch on 9-grain wheat bread; standard tuna salad (tuna mixed with mayo), lettuce, tomatoes, onions, cucumbers; no cheese, oil, or extra sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, exact ingredients, bread type, portion size, and customizations. Check Subway's official app or site for latest values.

quick_answer.text: A standard 6-inch Subway tuna salad sandwich has about 480 kcal and 20 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison with Subway's labeling.

faqs.q: How many calories in a Subway tuna salad sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 480 kcal for a 6-inch version with standard toppings.

faqs.q: What's the protein in Subway tuna sandwich?
faqs.a: About 20 g protein per 6-inch tuna salad sandwich.

faqs.q: Is the Subway tuna sandwich high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 1260 mg sodium due to bread, tuna salad, and veggies.

faqs.q: Calories in Subway tuna sub without mayo?
faqs.a: Reducing mayo can cut ~100 kcal, bringing it to about 380 kcal.

faqs.q: How does bread choice affect calories in Subway tuna sandwich?
faqs.a: Wheat is standard at 480 kcal; Italian white herbs adds ~20 kcal, flatbread subtracts ~50 kcal.
